corpus.text: The derivative of a function of a real variable measures the sensitivity to change of the function value (output value) with respect to a change in its argument (input value). The derivative of a function at a chosen input value, when it exists, is the slope of the tangent line to the graph of the function at that point. The process of finding a derivative is called differentiation.
corpus.probe_question: What is the derivative of a function?

corpus.text: The derivative measures the instantaneous rate of change of a function. It's the slope of the tangent line at a point on the function's graph.
The derivative is the slope of a function's graph.
